summary: Adds a script that allows you to automatically enable and disable objects (mostly lights) based on the current day time. With a tutorial how to set up.
descriptionHtml:
[b][color=yellow]Disclaimer[/b]
The script distributed by this mod is taken from the \"[url=http://www.creationkit.com/Light_Switch]Light Switch[/url]\" solution on the official Creation Kit wiki, written by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=538859]Cipscis[/url].
I\'m no native speaker, so my english might not always be correct.[/color]


[b]What it does[/b]
Automatic Light Switch (ALS) is not a stand-alone mod; it\'s a modder\'s resource. It provides a simple yet effective script to other mod authors. Most player home mods suffer from a minor inconvenience: their exterior lights are still \'on\' during the day. ALS disables light sources for a specific period of time that can be set independently for each object. And the best thing: It\'s not limited to light sources; you can as well manipulate other things like traps. 


[b]Requirements[/b]
To read the ReadMe and the Tutorial, you need a program that can open .pdf files, like [url=http://get.adobe.com/reader]Adobe Reader[/url].


[b]Installation[/b]
Just copy [i]AutomaticLightSwitchScript.pex[/i]  from the [i]script[/i]  folder to your [i]skyrim\\data[/i] folder
Default path: [i]C:\\Program Files\\Steam\\SteamApps\\common\\skyrim\\Data\\script[/i]

 
[b]Uninstallation[/b]
Just delete [i]AutomaticLightSwitchScript.pex[/i] from your [i]skyrim\\data\\script[/i] folder.


[b]Incompatibilities[/b]
None


[b]Credits[/b]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=538859]Cipscis[/url] for the script, found at the official Creation Kit wiki (Light Switch)


[b]Permissions[/b]
Feel free to create some sort of compatibility patch for your player home or whatever youâ€™re creating, just give proper credit to me and Cipscis.
